statement.tex: \text{If }\lfloor x\rfloor\text{ is the greatest integer function, then} \\ \text{for what values of 'x' would the following}\\ \text{be true?} \\ \qquad \lfloor x\rfloor^2 -9\lfloor x\rfloor + 14 = 0

step.context: \text{Given what }\lfloor x\rfloor\text{ is, would the following}\\ \text{values of }\underline{\text{x}}\text{ satisfy the given equation?}
step.reason: \begin{align} \lfloor x\rfloor^2 -9\lfloor x\rfloor + 14 &= 0 \\ \implies (\lfloor x \rfloor - 2)\cdot (\lfloor x \rfloor - 7) &= 0 \\ \implies \lfloor x \rfloor &= 2,7 \end{align} \\ \text{But remember, there are \underline{\text{infinite values of x}}\\ \text{for which }\lfloor x \rfloor = 2\text{ and }\lfloor x \rfloor = 7. \\ \text{For example, }\\ \lfloor 2.4 \rfloor = \lfloor 2 \rfloor = \lfloor 2.99 \rfloor = 2 \\ \text{Hence, we can infer that }\\ \begin{align} \lfloor x \rfloor &= 2 \implies x\in [2,3) \\ \lfloor x \rfloor &= 7 \implies x\in [7,8) \end{align} \\ \text{Therefore, }x\in [2,3)\cup [7,8).
